conclusion: Analyze the relationship between velocity squared versus displacement to determine acceleration.
The graph shows v² on the y-axis versus x on the x-axis. Both cars start at the same position and move in the same direction with uniform acceleration.
Recall the kinematic equation v² = v₀² + 2ax for uniformly accelerated motion.
Both lines on the graph are straight, confirming uniform acceleration. Line A has a steeper slope than line B. Line A starts at v² = 0, and Line B starts at v² = 1.
The slope of the v²-x graph is equal to 2a, so acceleration a = (slope)/2.
Calculate the slope for car A using points (0,0) and (0.5,2): Slope of A = 4, therefore a_A = 2 m/s².
Calculate the slope for car B using points (0,1) and (0.5,2): Slope of B = 2, therefore a_B = 1 m/s².
Car A has the greater acceleration (2 m/s²) compared to Car B (1 m/s²) because the slope of line A is steeper than the slope of line B.
